title: About fonts that looks as if they were printed
content:
Hi all,

I have found [Alte Haas Grotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414021150/http:/www.dafont.com/es/alte-haas-grotesk.font), a font that looks like Helvetica printed. I don't know if is very correct to use this kind of fonts for a book cover. What do you think?

M.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [images.jpeg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414021150/http:/typophile.com/files/images_2.jpeg) | 16.24 KB |
author: MarcelG

comments.content: I suppose it depends on what an old Joseph Muller-Brookman book is and what your book is.
